intro: Chorizanthe angustifolia var. eastwoodiae, commonly known as the Eastwood's narrowleaf choris, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, such as sandy soils and rocky areas. It produces seeds that are adapted to disperse in dry conditions, aiding in its survival in harsh climates. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in desert ecosystems.
